Posts.Content: Patrithia wrote: Has anyone gotten a horrible rash with Taxol/Herceptin?  I've had it for 5 months (3 months during the treatments and 2 months after treatment).  I've been to a derm. and allergist.  They think it is related to the chemo (after biopsy).  Not sure if it was the Taxol or the Herceptin.  I need to start on Herceptin alone this week (it's been one month of waiting due to the rash).  Yes, I had the pre-meds with all treatments and I was also on several steriods packs.  I'm suffering so much with this rash; it has taken over my life (soaking, creams, pills, not sleeping, etc.).  I would love to hear from you and want to know who long did it last?  The "half life" of taxol is 17 days...so it takes about 85 days to leave your system..anyone have experience with this?  Help!  Patricia Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: HER2+ Rash with T/H Patrithia Patrithia

Posts.Content: Jan 21, 2012 10:57PM Patrithia wrote: Hello Doxie,   Thank you for your post.  I may take your advice and check with a oncology pharmacist (they probably have one at Mayo).  I'll try anything at this point!  You have helped alot and I appreciate it.   Patricia
Posts.Title: HER2+ Rash with T/H Patrithia Patrithia

Posts.Content: Jan 16, 2012 08:10AM Patrithia wrote: LeesaAnn, I am grateful that they found!    "Stay in the day" and "keep your head up" were my two mottos.  Yes, fear of the unknown can worry us; however, between great doctors and my own research, it wasn't so bad.  Take each thing as it comes so that you don't get overwhelmed.  I had a bi-lateral mastecomy last April.  Chemo (A/C) 4 rounds and T/H 12 rounds completed November 17.  I'm not beginning my 5th week of radiation...I'm almost there :-).  I had clear margins and it did not spread to my lymph nodes; I look at this as my insurance policy for the future.  I did get a rash from the Taxol (but that is rare).  Please let me know if you have any questions.  Wishing you the very best.  Patricia  P.S.  Did anyone else out there get a rash from Taxol?  If so, please write to me about it.
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan - December 2011 LeesaAnn AnnieLane

Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2012 09:45PM Patrithia wrote: Hi,  I wasn't going to get the tatoos thinking that they would be obvious; however, after a week of the "stickers" I changed my mind (trying to be careful in shower, etc.). The tatoos were like a tiny dot (like a freckel) and I'm so glad I did them. Patrithia

Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2012 01:16PM Patrithia wrote: Hello,  I began radiation mid-January also.  Yesterday was the beginning of my 4th week (6 weeks in total).    Yesterday I began to notice some red on my skin; I'm using Aloe gel (pure) is there anything else that you know of to treat the skin?  I did get a prescription cream from the doctor (will pick it up tomorrow).  Thank you in advance for answering my questions. Best, Patrithia
